root: ^MOTHER: Nicely done, Kay. Our goats look almost as well fed as Thomas.

^MOTHER: I'm only joking. Kay, are you sure you're still willing to go into town this morning? Its' starting to look a little stormy. I saw Dr Leonora running around earlier, waiving her lightning rod and talking about electric-prognostication. I don't know what that means but I don't like how it sounds...

s: ^KAY: Of course, Mother. A few clouds don't bother me. But I heard a strange noise when I was half asleep this morning. Did you hear anything?
^KAY: Hmm, that sounds a bit odd. Electric prognostication?

c-0: ^THOMAS: Yeah, I heard some howling earlier. Clouds aren’t what I’d be worried about this morning...
^FATHER: I heard the howling too. We’ve never had wolves in this part of England before, but it worried me. Here, Kay. Better bring your scythe along. You never know.
^THOMAS: And bring me back some sweets.
c-1: ^MOTHER: I assume it means predicting the weather by measuring electric charge. But it’s hard to get anything coherent out of the Doctor.
^FATHER: She just barreled from the trees on the west side of our farm, straight through and into the trees on the right. Waving her lightning rod.
^MOTHER: Kay, you’d better bring this into town.
^KAY: My electric lamp! I thought you’d got rid of it.
^FATHER: We thought it was too dangerous to let you keep tinkering with it.
^MOTHER: But we would never simply throw one of your inventions out.
^FATHER: Take it with you. If there is a lightning storm, maybe it will deflect and absorb some of the electricity.
^MOTHER: And I’m sure it has a ton of other uses.
^KAY: But I was still working out a few kinks.
^MOTHER: Your little brother may be a pest –
^[THOMAS: Hey! You’re supposed to be my mom!]
^MOTHER: –  but he looks up to you. He’s become quite the tinkerer himself.

s: ^KAY: Thank you, Thomas. When I get back, I'd love to talk about electrical science with you.
^KAY: I hope the little urchin didn't mess up the generator...

c-1: ^MOTHER: Well, you’d better be off, Kay.
^THOMAS: And bring me back some sweets!
